analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The reverse order of the law of conditionality, The Paṭṭhāna text with the Tika commentary

original: 23.37. Ajjhattattika, Kusalattika🔽Naajjhattaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā bahiddhā kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: ajjhatta ttika kusala ttika  na ajjhattam na kusalam dhammam paccayā bahiddhā kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Internal, wholesome triad🔽With an internal, wholesome state as condition, an external, wholesome state arises, by way of root-cause condition.

original: Nabahiddhā nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā ajjhatto kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na bahiddhā na kusalam dhammam paccayā ajjhattaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an external, wholesome state as condition, an internal, wholesome state arises, by way of root-cause condition.

original: (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.🔽Naajjhattaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā bahiddhā akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: saṅkhitta hetuyā dve pe avigate dve  na ajjhattam na akusalam dhammam paccayā bahiddhā akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: (Abbreviated.) Two by way of root-cause condition … Two by way of non-hindrance condition.🔽With an internal, unwholesome state as condition, an external, unwholesome state arises, by way of root-cause condition.

original: Nabahiddhā naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā ajjhatto akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na bahiddhā na akusalam dhammam paccayā ajjhattaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an external, unwholesome state as condition, an internal, unwholesome state arises, by way of root-cause condition.

original: (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.🔽Naajjhattaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bahiddhā abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: saṅkhitta hetuyā dve pe avigate dve  na ajjhattam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca bahiddhā abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: (Abbreviated.) Two by way of root-cause condition … Two by way of non-hindrance condition.🔽With an internal, indeterminate state as condition, an external, indeterminate state arises, by way of root-cause condition.

original: Nabahiddhā naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhatto abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na bahiddhā na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca ajjhattaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an external, indeterminate state as condition, an internal, indeterminate state arises, by way of root-cause condition.

original: (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā dve, adhipatiyā dve …pe… avigate dve.
analyzed: dve adhipatiyā dve pe avigate dve
translated: As object of protest there are two; …
